meanings.definition: A length of hair made up of three or more interlaced strands.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful braid in her hair.
meanings.sent2: Her long braid swayed as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The princess's braid was so long, it reached the floor.
meanings.sent4: The braid of flowers in her hair added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The intricate braid was a work of art.

meanings.definition: To weave together three or more strands of hair or other material.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to braid her hair at a young age.
meanings.sent2: He likes to braid ropes to make them stronger.
meanings.sent3: I tried to braid spaghetti, but it was a messy disaster.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to braid its way through the valley.
meanings.sent5: She carefully braided the ribbons together.

meanings.definition: A complex pattern formed by intertwining three or more strands of material.
meanings.sent1: The braid of the basket was beautifully intricate.
meanings.sent2: The rug had a colorful braid along its edge.
meanings.sent3: The braid of lights on the Christmas tree was dazzling.
meanings.sent4: The braid of roads in the city created a confusing maze.
meanings.sent5: The braid of vines twisted around the tree trunk.
